TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit ComboBoxRenderer extends System.Object
public ref class ComboBoxRenderer abstract sealed
.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ComboBoxRenderer extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides methods used to render a combo box control with visual styles. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer> class provides a set of `static` methods that can be used to render a combo box control with the current visual style of the operating system. Rendering a control refers to drawing the user interface of a control. This is useful if you are drawing a custom control that should have the appearance of the current visual style. To draw a combo box, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawTextBox%2A> method to draw the text box and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawDropDownButton%2A> method to draw the drop-down arrow.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawTextBox%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawDropDownButton%2A> will draw the combo box with the current visual style. Otherwise, these methods will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>. To determine whether the members of this class can be used, you can check the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property.
This class wraps the functionality of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer?displayProperty=nameWithType> that is set to one of the elements exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ComboBox.DropDownButton?displayProperty=nameWithType> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.TextBox.TextEdit?displayProperty=nameWithType> classes. For more information, see [Rendering Controls with Visual Styles](/dotnet/framework/winforms/controls/rendering-controls-with-visual-styles).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a custom control that uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawTextBox%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawDropDownButton%2A> methods to draw a combo box that responds to mouse clicks.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer#0](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer/cpp/form1.cpp#0)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer#0](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer/CS/form1.cs#0)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer#0](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer/VB/form1.vb#0)]

Public Shared Sub DrawDropDownButton (g As Graphics, bounds As Rectangle, state As ComboBoxState)

Docs.param: The used to draw the drop-down arrow.
The that specifies the bounds of the drop-down arrow.
One of the values that specifies the visual state of the drop-down arrow.
Docs.summary: Draws a drop-down arrow with the current visual style of the operating system.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Before calling this method, you should verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property returns `true`.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawDropDownButton%2A> method in a custom control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnPaint%2A> method to draw a drop-down arrow in the state determined by the location of the mouse pointer. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer> class.

-or-

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool IsSupported { get; }
.property bool IsSupported
Public Shared ReadOnly Property IsSupported As Boolean
public: static property bool IsSupported { bool get(); };
member this.IsSupported : bool

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the class can be used to draw a combo box with visual styles.
Docs.value: if the user has enabled visual styles in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this property is `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawTextBox%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawDropDownButton%2A> methods will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property to determine whether to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer> methods. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer> class.
